Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
January 30 and Feb 6 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
• (1) The licensee shall provide an orientation
program for new employees. Job shadowing shall
not be the only form of orientation. The orientation
shall include the following:
• (b) The role of the staff members as
related to service delivery and protection
of the children.
Orientation documentation was not completed for two of twelve staff until after the
staff were already working with the youth.
2

CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (1) The social service worker shall complete,
sign, and date an updated treatment plan for each
resident at least once every 90-calendar days
following the initial treatment plan.
One of nine updated treatments plans was completed 6 days late.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
• (1) When a resident is discharged from
institutional care, all of the following information
shall be documented in the case record within 14
days after discharge:
• (f) The name and official title of the person
to whom the resident was discharged.
Two of three discharge plans did not include the name and official title of the
person to whom the resident was discharged.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The 2023 Renewal Report cited Rules 152 (a), (d) & (e), 155 (3), 113 (j) and 128
(3). The CAP was completed and approved on 2/14/23. There were no repeat
violations during this licensing period.
3

Financial Overview
There were no financial concerns identified in the annual audit reviewed.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
One CAP was submitted for the period under review. No additional issues were
noted by the Chief Administrator.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff gave positive reviews of the facility.
All youth were satisfied with their treatment at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the dining room, general living area, hallways, staff offices, and
bedrooms. I observed the pantry, refrigerator, stove, and freezer in the kitchen and
the medication room, cart and logs. There were no licensing rule violations
identified.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
